people.name: Casimir Funk
people.description: Kazimierz Funk [kaˈʑimjɛʂ ˈfuŋk] , commonly anglicized as Casimir Funk, was a Polish biochemist, generally credited with being among the first to formulate  the concept of vitamins, which he called "vital amines" or "vitamines".

people.name: Andrew Williams
people.description: Andrew Williams  was a nineteenth-century politician, manufacturer, merchant and miner from New York.

people.name: Jack Liebowitz
people.description: Jacob S.  "Jack" Liebowitz  was an American accountant and publisher, known primarily as the co-owner with Harry Donenfeld of National Allied Publications .

people.name: Leonard Beecher
people.description: Leonard James Beecher CMG  was an English-born Anglican Archbishop.

people.name: Robert Huber
people.description: Robert Huber ForMemRS  is a German biochemist and Nobel laureate.

people.name: Ruth DeEtte Simpson
people.description: Ruth DeEtte Simpson  was an important woman archeologist at a time when the field of archeology was still dominated by men.

people.name: Alfred Romer
people.description: Alfred Sherwood Romer  was an American paleontologist and biologist and a specialist in vertebrate evolution.

people.name: George Gaylord Simpson
people.description: George Gaylord Simpson  was an American paleontologist.

people.name: Charles Schuchert
people.description: Charles Schuchert  was an American invertebrate paleontologist who was a leader in the development of paleogeography, the study of the distribution of lands and seas in the geological past.
